alert.note: Alert for Kent; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 4:44PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Kent and southwestern Stonewall Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 443 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Jayton to Clairemont. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jayton and Clairemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Light accumulations of small hail will be possible along and adjacent to roadways. Consider moving to a sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
